note.p: Education: University of London. BSc (1870), MB (1871), DSc (1872).

Career: Demonstrator to Michael Foster, Trinity Praelector in Physiology (1870-1876); Fellow of Christ's College, Cambridge (1874-1879); President of the Union, Cambridge (1875); Professor of Biology at Johns Hopkins University, Baltimore (1876-1893); retired due to ill health (1893); co-wrote with Thomas Huxley 'Practical instruction in elementary biology'; died of a haemorrhage
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1896-1897 vol 60 pp xx-xxiii signed by M F
